co.cask.cdap.api.annotation

Annotation Type Tick


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value=METHOD)
public @interface Tick
    Annotates a Flowletâ€™s method to indicate that, instead of processing data objects from a Flowlet input, this method is invoked periodically without arguments.

    For example, this can be used to generate data or to pull data from an external data source periodically on a fixed cadence. 

     
 public class RandomSource extends AbstractFlowlet {
   private OutputEmitter<Integer> randomOutput;

   private final Random random = new Random();

   @Tick(delay = 1L, unit = TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS)
   public void generate() throws InterruptedException {
     randomOutput.emit(random.nextInt(10000));
   }
 }
    See Also:
    Flowlet

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      long delay
      Time to delay between the termination of one tick call and the start of the next one.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      long initialDelay
      Initial delay before calling the tick method for the first time.
      int maxRetries
      Optionally specifies the maximum number of retries of failure inputs before giving up.
      TimeUnit unit
      Time unit for both initialDelay() and delay().

    • Element Detail

      • delay

        public abstract long delay
        Time to delay between the termination of one tick call and the start of the next one.
        Returns:
        Time to delay between calls.

      • initialDelay

        public abstract long initialDelay
        Initial delay before calling the tick method for the first time. Default is 0.
        Returns:
        Time for the initial delay.
        Default:
        0L

      • unit

        public abstract TimeUnit unit
        Time unit for both initialDelay() and delay(). Default is TimeUnit.SECONDS.
        Returns:
        The time unit.
        Default:
        java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit.SECONDS

      • maxRetries

        public abstract int maxRetries
        Optionally specifies the maximum number of retries of failure inputs before giving up. Defaults to 0 (no retry).
        Default:
        0
